Package org.guicebox.failover

Interface Summary
Heart Sends and receives heartbeats to advertise this node's presence and detect the presence of other nodes in the cluster.
HeartbeatListener Listener interface for Heart.
Ping Confirms availability of a specified network address.
PingListener Listener interface for Ping.
Transport Interface to the physical transport layer for broadcast distribution of Heartbeats to other nodes on the network.
 

Class Summary
Failover Implements a simple but effective active-passive failover strategy for high availability.
FailoverModule Binds Failover as the Cluster implementation.
Heartbeat A heartbeat message, containing the application (cluster) name, node status and process fingerprint.
JavaPing Utility for pinging a specified network address.
Node The unique fingerprint of a node process in the cluster.
NonBlockingHeart Utility for sending and receiving heartbeats.
 

Exception Summary
TransportException Generic exception indicating that an error occurred while attempting to send/receive a heartbeat.
 

Annotation Types Summary
ApplicationName The name of the application.
DestinationPort The port to broadcast to, used in conjunction with GroupAddress.
Environment The name of the environment.
GroupAddress The multicast address for broadcasting "I'm the primary" heartbeat messages to other nodes in the cluster.
HeartbeatInterval Time between heartbeats.
HeartbeatTolerance The number of heartbeats it is permissible to miss before declaring ourself primary.
Localhost The IP address of this machine.
PingInterval Time between between ping attempts, in milliseconds.
PingTolerance How many multiples of PingInterval to wait before assuming the ping has failed.
ProcessId A globally unique identifier for the running process.
SourcePort The port to broadcast from, used in conjunction with GroupAddress.
TimeToLive The number of router hops you want the heartbeart to be able to traverse.
WellKnownAddress The hostname or IP address of the machine to ping.
